page.title: 09CHURCHES
page.content: There is a large CHURCH in Walpole St. Peter which is sometimes called the cathedral of the Fens.Built in the 14th century its large size indicates the great wealth in the area at that time.This wealth came from sheep farming.Today a new vicarage is being built next to the church ready for the arrival for a new incumbent.There is a church at Walpole St Andrew but two years ago this became redundant.There is an additional Methodist church and schoolroom.The main church service is held at 10:30a.m.each Sunday,whilst the Methodists' meet on a Sunday afternoon.It is interesting to note that above the Walpole St. Peter Church porch there is the original schoolroom which was opened in 1723 and paid for by Anthony Curton.
